info.title: YunoHost API
info.description: This is the YunoHost API used on all YunoHost instances. This API is essentially used by YunoHost Webadmin.

tags.name: diagnosis
tags.description: Look for possible issues on the server

post.summary: Logs in and returns the authentication cookie

get.summary: List users

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: fields to fetch (username, fullname, mail, mail-alias, mail-forward, mailbox-quota, groups, shell, home-path)

domain.description: Domain for the email address and xmpp account

parameters.name: purge
parameters.description: Purge user's home and mail directories

get.summary: Get user information

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username or email to get information

get.summary: Export users into CSV

csvfile.description: CSV file with columns username, firstname, lastname, password, mail, mailbox-quota, mail-alias, mail-forward, groups (separated by coma)

update.description: Update all existing users contained in the CSV file (by default existing users are ignored)

delete.description: Delete all existing users that are not contained in the CSV file (by default existing users are kept)

get.summary: List existing groups

parameters.name: short
parameters.description: List only the names of groups

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Display all informations known about each groups

parameters.name: include_primary_groups
parameters.description: Also display primary groups (each user has an eponym group that only contains itself)

groupname.description: Name of the group to be created

parameters.name: groupname
parameters.description: Name of the group to be deleted

get.summary: Get information about a specific group

parameters.name: groupname
parameters.description: Name of the group to fetch info about

groupname.description: Name of the group to add user(s) to

usernames.description: User(s) to add in the group

groupname.description: Name of the group to remove user(s) from

usernames.description: User(s) to remove from the group

get.summary: List permissions and corresponding accesses

parameters.name: apps
parameters.description: Apps to list permission for (all by default)

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Display all info known about each permission, including the full user list of each group it is granted to.

get.summary: Get information about a specific permission

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: Name of the permission to fetch info about (use "yunohost user permission list" and "yunohost user permission -f" to see all the current permissions)

permission.description: Permission to manage (e.g. mail or nextcloud or wordpress.editors) (use "yunohost user permission list" and "yunohost user permission -f" to see all the current permissions)

label.description: Label for this permission. This label will be shown on the SSO and in the admin

show_tile.description: Define if a tile will be shown in the SSO

delete.summary: Reset allowed groups to the default (all_users) for a given permission

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: Permission to manage (e.g. mail or nextcloud or wordpress.editors) (use "yunohost user permission list" and "yunohost user permission -f" to see all the current permissions)

put.summary: Grant permission to group or user

permission.description: Permission to manage (e.g. mail or nextcloud or wordpress.editors) (use "yunohost user permission list" and "yunohost user permission -f" to see all the current permissions)

names.description: Group or usernames to grant this permission to

put.summary: Revoke permission to group or user

permission.description: Permission to manage (e.g. mail or nextcloud or wordpress.editors) (use "yunohost user permission list" and "yunohost user permission -f" to see all the current permissions)

names.description: Group or usernames to revoke this permission to

get.summary: Show user's authorized ssh keys

post.summary: Add a new authorized ssh key for this user

delete.summary: Remove an authorized ssh key for this user

get.summary: List domains

parameters.name: exclude_subdomains
parameters.description: Filter out domains that are obviously subdomains of other declared domains

parameters.name: remove_apps
parameters.description: Remove apps installed on the domain

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Do not ask confirmation to remove apps

get.summary: Check the current main domain, or change it

put.summary: Check the current main domain, or change it

get.summary: Check availability of a web path

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The domain for the web path (e.g. your.domain.tld)

get.summary: Display a domain configuration

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A specific panel, section or a question identifier

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Display all details (meant to be used by the API)

parameters.name: export
parameters.description: Only export key/values, meant to be reimported using "config set --args-file"

get.summary: Generate sample DNS configuration for a domain
Generate sample DNS configuration for a domain

domain.description: Domain name to push DNS conf for

dry_run.description: Only display what's to be pushed

force.description: Also update/remove records which were not originally set by Yunohost, or which have been manually modified

get.summary: List status of current certificates (all by default).

put.summary: Install Let's Encrypt certificates for given domains (all by default).

domain_list.description: Domains for which to install the certificates

force.description: Install even if current certificate is not self-signed

no_checks.description: Does not perform any check that your domain seems correctly configured (DNS, reachability) before attempting to install. (Not recommended)

self_signed.description: Install self-signed certificate instead of Let's Encrypt

put.summary: Renew the Let's Encrypt certificates for given domains (all by default).

domain_list.description: Domains for which to renew the certificates

email.description: Send an email to root with logs if some renewing fails

no_checks.description: Does not perform any check that your domain seems correctly configured (DNS, reachability) before attempting to renew. (Not recommended)

get.summary: Show the catalog of installable application

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Display all details, including the app manifest and various other infos

parameters.name: with_categories
parameters.description: Also return a list of app categories

get.summary: Return the manifest of a given app from the catalog, or from a remote git repo

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Name, local path or git URL of the app to fetch the manifest of

get.summary: List installed apps

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Display all details, including the app manifest and various other infos

parameters.name: upgradable
parameters.description: List only apps that can upgrade to a newer version

app.description: Name, local path or git URL of the app to install

no_remove_on_failure.description: Debug option to avoid removing the app on a failed installation

force.description: Do not ask confirmation if the app is not safe to use (low quality, experimental or 3rd party)

get.summary: Show infos about a specific installed app

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Display all details, including the app manifest and various other infos

get.summary: Show the mapping between urls and apps

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Allowed app map for a user

url.description: Git url to fetch for upgrade

force.description: Force the update, even though the app is up to date

no_safety_backup.description: Disable the safety backup during upgrade

domain.description: New app domain on which the application will be moved

path.description: New path at which the application will be moved

get.summary: Set or get an app setting value

put.summary: Redirect domain root to an app

app.description: App name to put on domain root

domain.description: Specific domain to put app on (the app domain by default)

get.summary: List app actions
Display an app configuration

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A specific panel, section or a question identifier

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Display all details (meant to be used by the API)

parameters.name: export
parameters.description: Only export key/values, meant to be reimported using "config set --args-file"

args_file.description: YAML or JSON file with key/value couples

post.summary: Create a backup local archive. If neither --apps or --system are given, this will backup all apps and all system parts. If only --apps if given, this will only backup apps and no system parts. Similarly, if only --system is given, this will only backup system parts and no apps.

methods.description: List of backup methods to apply (copy or tar by default)

system.description: List of system parts to backup (or all if none given).

apps.description: List of application names to backup (or all if none given)

dry_run.description: 'Simulate' the backup and return the size details per item to backup

get.summary: List available local backup archives

parameters.name: with_info
parameters.description: Show backup information for each archive

parameters.name: human_readable
parameters.description: Print sizes in human readable format

put.summary: Restore from a local backup archive. If neither --apps or --system are given, this will restore all apps and all system parts in the archive. If only --apps if given, this will only restore apps and no system parts. Similarly, if only --system is given, this will only restore system parts and no apps.

name.description: Name of the local backup archive

system.description: List of system parts to restore (or all if none is given)

apps.description: List of application names to restore (or all if none is given)

force.description: Force restauration on an already installed system

get.summary: Show info about a local backup archive

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the local backup archive

parameters.name: human_readable
parameters.description: Print sizes in human readable format

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the archive to delete

get.summary: (API only) Request to download the file

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the local backup archive

get.summary: list all entries of the settings

delete.summary: reset all settings to their default value

get.summary: get an entry value in the settings

post.summary: set an entry value in the settings

delete.summary: set an entry value to its default one

put.summary: Restart one or more services. If the services are not running yet, they will be started.

get.summary: Show status information about one or more services (all by default)
Show status information about one or more services (all by default)
Log every log files of a service
List all firewall rules

port.description: Port or range of ports to open

ipv4_only.description: Only add a rule for IPv4 connections

ipv6_only.description: Only add a rule for IPv6 connections

no_upnp.description: Do not add forwarding of this port with UPnP

port.description: Port or range of ports to close

ipv4_only.description: Only remove the rule for IPv4 connections

ipv6_only.description: Only remove the rule for IPv6 connections

upnp_only.description: Only remove forwarding of this port with UPnP

put.summary: Change password of admin and root users

ignore_dyndns.description: Do not subscribe domain to a DynDNS service

force_password.description: Use this if you really want to set a weak password

force_diskspace.description: Use this if you really want to install YunoHost on a setup with less than 10 GB on the root filesystem

target.description: What to update, "apps" (application catalog) or "system" (fetch available package upgrades, equivalent to apt update), "all" for both
What to upgrade, either "apps" (all apps) or "system" (all system packages)

names.description: Categories to regenerate configuration of (all by default)

with_diff.description: Show differences in case of configuration changes

force.description: Override all manual modifications in configuration files

dry_run.description: Show what would have been regenerated

list_pending.description: List pending configuration files and exit

names.description: Categories to regenerate configuration of (all by default)

with_diff.description: Show differences in case of configuration changes

force.description: Override all manual modifications in configuration files

dry_run.description: Show what would have been regenerated

list_pending.description: List pending configuration files and exit

get.summary: Display YunoHost's packages versions
List migrations

targets.description: Migrations to run (all pendings by default)

skip.description: Skip specified migrations (to be used only if you know what you are doing)

force_rerun.description: Re-run already-ran specified migration (to be used only if you know what you are doing)

auto.description: Automatic mode, won't run manual migrations (to be used only if you know what you are doing)

accept_disclaimer.description: Accept disclaimers of migrations (please read them before using this option)

targets.description: Migrations to run (all pendings by default)

skip.description: Skip specified migrations (to be used only if you know what you are doing)

force_rerun.description: Re-run already-ran specified migration (to be used only if you know what you are doing)

auto.description: Automatic mode, won't run manual migrations (to be used only if you know what you are doing)

accept_disclaimer.description: Accept disclaimers of migrations (please read them before using this option)

get.summary: List available hooks for an action
List logs

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of operations to list (default to 50)

parameters.name: with_details
parameters.description: Show additional infos (e.g. operation success) but may significantly increase command time. Consider using --limit in combination with this.

parameters.name: with_suboperations
parameters.description: Include metadata about operations that are not the main operation but are sub-operations triggered by another ongoing operation... (e.g. initializing groups/permissions when installing an app)

get.summary: Display a log content

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Log file which to display the content

parameters.name: share
parameters.description: (Deprecated, see yunohost log share) Share the full log using yunopaste

parameters.name: filter_irrelevant
parameters.description: Do not show some lines deemed not relevant (like set +x or helper argument parsing)

parameters.name: with_suboperations
parameters.description: Include metadata about sub-operations of this operation... (e.g. initializing groups/permissions when installing an app)

get.summary: Share the full log on yunopaste (alias to show --share)
List diagnosis categories
Show most recents diagnosis results

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Diagnosis categories to display (all by default)

get.summary: Low-level command to fetch raw data and status about a specific diagnosis test

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Diagnosis category to fetch results from

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: List of criteria describing the test. Must correspond exactly to the 'meta' infos in 'yunohost diagnosis show'

categories.description: Diagnosis categories to run (all by default)

force.description: Ignore the cached report even if it is still 'fresh'

except_if_never_ran_yet.description: Don't run anything if diagnosis never ran yet ... (this is meant to be used by the webadmin)

email.description: Send an email to root with issues found (this is meant to be used by cron job)

put.summary: Configure some diagnosis results to be ignored and therefore not considered as actual issues

filter.description: Add a filter. The first element should be a diagnosis category, and other criterias can be provided using the infos from the 'meta' sections in 'yunohost diagnosis show'. For example: 'dnsrecords domain=yolo.test category=xmpp'

put.summary: Configure some diagnosis results to be unignored and therefore considered as actual issues

filter.description: Remove a filter (it should be an existing filter as listed with --list)
